meanings.definition: A type of cell found in connective tissue that produces collagen and other fibers.
meanings.sent1: The fibroblasts in our skin help in making it strong and flexible.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how fibroblasts work to understand tissue structure better.
meanings.sent3: The fibroblasts at the construction site are like tiny builders creating a strong foundation.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was as resilient as the fibroblasts building new tissue.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the fibroblasts look like busy workers weaving a web of support.

meanings.definition: Cells that play a critical role in wound healing and tissue repair.
meanings.sent1: After the injury, fibroblasts rush to the site to start the healing process.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how fibroblasts help in repairing damaged tissues.
meanings.sent3: The fibroblasts seemed to be having a party, fixing up the wound with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: Like skilled craftsmen, fibroblasts meticulously mend the body's broken parts.
meanings.sent5: The fibroblasts worked tirelessly, like little repair crews fixing up the tissue.
